Each week PTA will be introducing you to a few of our amazing faculty/staff members. We want you to know our Fairmont family since we aren’t able to really be in the building and together like usual!! 🖤💛🐝

4. My favorite children's books are The Giving Tree by Shel Silverstein or Just in Case You Ever Wonder by Max Lucado. My favorite chapter book series is the Boxcar Children. (I read those in 1st grade when Mrs. McGill was my teacher)

5. I have many quotes I love but, my favorite is: If you want to change the world, go home and love your family. -Mother Teresa

Science Hill junior Jenna Hutchins has added another line to her astonishing resume. Congratulations, Jenna. We are so proud of you!

From Johnson City Press reporter Tanner Cook...

Science Hill junior and two-time cross country All-American Jenna Hutchins won the Music City Distance Carnival (Nashville) 3,200 meters on Saturday evening in a new meet and state record of 9:49.83, besting Rebecca Story’s state record by about 10 seconds.

Hutchins’ time is now fifth best in US High School history (at least according to the US Milesplit databases; includes all conversions from two miles) and is only about two seconds off of Katelyn Tuohy’s official HS national record.

Hutchins now owns the state record for the 1,600 meters (4:43.33 from last year’s MCDC), 3,200 meters (9:49.83) and is second on the all-time list for girls cross country 5K (16:38.97 from Desert Twilight XC Festival last fall).

She still has two years left. Wow. 🤯

Science Hill junior Jenna Hutchins has added another line to her astonishing resume. Congratulations, Jenna. We are so proud of you!

From Johnson City Press reporter Tanner Cook...

Science Hill junior and two-time cross country All-American Jenna Hutchins won the Music City Distance Carnival (Nashville) 3,200 meters on Saturday evening in a new meet and state record of 9:49.83, besting Rebecca Story’s state record by about 10 seconds.

Hutchins’ time is now fifth best in US High School history (at least according to the US Milesplit databases; includes all conversions from two miles) and is only about two seconds off of Katelyn Tuohy’s official HS national record.

Hutchins now owns the state record for the 1,600 meters (4:43.33 from last year’s MCDC), 3,200 meters (9:49.83) and is second on the all-time list for girls cross country 5K (16:38.97 from Desert Twilight XC Festival last fall).

She still has two years left. Wow. 🤯

Johnson City Schools' Counselors
March 25 at 7:00 AM ·

Welcome.

We are the Johnson City Schools District Counselors. We are here as a resource during this time. As counselors, our hearts are aligned towards interactions with our students and building solid relationships with them. During this time, we want to reach out and provide resources for our students and their families. This will be one of the many ways we can connect for now.

What you can expect from our social media platforms are some helpful tips, article, hotlines, resources, and a safe place you can ask questions. We are here to support. We are also here to link you, as a student, with your school counselor, if needed. Well, what if you are a parent or guardian? We are here for you as well.

So, welcome. We will take this journey together.

Please check Johnson City Schools website, www.jcschools.org, for the most recent updates.
